post_text: Such a joyful way to end the school year at the Pelham Ridge Elementary farewell parade! 💚 #ThePelhamWay
shared_text:
Pelham Ridge Elementary is with Tammy Hafner Causey.
May 19 at 9:50 PM ·

It is unbelievably hard to describe the feelings that came over “the Ridge” today. From 11:00am-12:00pm, we smiled, waved, danced, blew kisses, caught flowers, and cried as we said “farewell” to our 2019-2020 school year! WOW...WHAT A YEAR! We were a BALL of EMOTIONS because we NEEDED to see those smiles! In an imperfect world, their smiles are pure PERFECTION and we ALL needed that today! Thank you PRES families for making the “close” of this year one WE will never forget. EVER.

To our teachers, words cannot express how grateful we are to have such a WARM, and CARING group of individuals who truly LOVE their students! Daily, we are amazed at your selfless acts and we THANK YOU!

NOW...SCHOOL’S OUT FOR SUMMER! We hope you have an AMAZING summer and we will look forward to seeing you for our 2020-2021 school year!

*Post your pictures from the “Farewell Parade” in the comments!

#ridgeLIFE
#isTHEbestLIFE
#becauseOFourPRESfamily

Pelham City Schools is pleased to announce that Lisa Baxter has been selected as the future principal of Pelham Ridge Elementary. Mrs. Baxter will join the Pelham Ridge team on July 1.

Baxter has 20+ years of educational experience as a principal, assistant principal, instructional coach, and teacher in Jefferson County. She has also supported schools throughout the state as a regional coach for the Alabama Reading Initiative.

Mrs. Baxter says she looks forward to the wonderful opportunity to work with the school community at Pelham Ridge. She is a life-long learner who embodies servant leadership, strives to build relationships, and is driven to make a difference and build memories for the school's students, families, faculty, and staff.

Congratulations to the Teacher & Support Person of the Year Honorees from each of our schools!

Jeri Feliciano and Teri Wiedeburg from Pelham Oaks Elementary, Regina Dickens and Martee Forehand from Pelham Ridge Elementary, Meredith Collins and Angela Blocker from Pelham Park Middle School, and Juan Vasquez and Dennis Case from Pelham High School. The district honorees will serve as the Pelham City Schools' representatives in the Alabama Teacher of the Year program.

This wonderful group of teachers and staff came together with family and colleagues to celebrate their accomplishments at a reception sponsored by the Pelham City Schools Foundation prior to the Board of Education meeting on Monday.
